alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 8:02PM EDT until August 16 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Colleton, Dorchester and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Varnville and Cummings to Bells Crossroads. As much as 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen so far this evening. An additional 1 to 3 inches could fall through 915 PM. Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas is likely. - A Flash Flood Warning remains in effect for northeast Colleton County and far western Dorchester County until 930 PM. Please refer to that bulletin for more information. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Colleton, Varnville, Brunson, Smoaks, Williams, Islandton, Ruffin, Ashton, Miley, Cummings, Crocketville, Early Branch, Almeda Intersection, Canadys, Bells Crossroads, Caldwell and Smyly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
